name: Capital Enterprise
slogan: We are London’s startup experts: connecting & energising a world-class entrepreneurship ecosystem
description: Capital Enterprise aims to support London based tech startup to grow and scale - we do this through a number of programme which provides access to investment, mentorship, talent and hardware

jobs.title: IDEALondon Receptionist/Front of House/Community Coordinator
jobs.description:
**About IDEALondon**
IDEALondon is an innovation centre run by a world-class partnership of University College London, Barclays, EDF Energy and Capital Enterprise. With light-touch, high relevance support, IDEALondon offers a unique mix of expertise and experience to enable tech startups to flourish. 
 
**Your Purpose**
We define the IDEALondon experience from the very beginning and you are a key part of this.
You will be the first person our startups/visitors/partners meet each morning, and you’re the one they seek out for support for all things hospitality, operations, events and day to day admin needs.
As the Front of House/Community Coordinator, you will need to consistently deliver the following:
●      high standard of reception and hospitality
●     an ability to deal with a variety of questions in a friendly and enthusiastic manner
●     awesome customer service - you remember names and go out of your way to help our guests
●     high attention to detail – you are a clean freak and notice when anything is out of place
●     a confident and swift administrator
●     willing to embrace new technology 
●      you take pride in the space and make sure IDEALondon always looks it’s best
 
**You will have the following skills, experience and personality to be successful in this role:**
●    Experience in a previous customer focussed role (retail, serving or receptionist role )
●    Friendly, personable and outgoing manner
●    Highly organised with attention to detail. You are a clean freak and enjoy taking pride in your space. 
●    Ability to communicate effectively with people on all levels and with all different backgrounds, from students to CEOs
●    A proactive problem-solver who is able to adapt to an ever-changing environment
●    Able to work on own initiative with minimal supervision and calmly under pressure
●    Able to safely lift heavy objects to set up for events
●    Strong administrative skills
Nice to haves 
●    Strong interest in the tech startup ecosystem in London
●    Experience working with different administrative platforms  
●    Thrive and have prior experience of working in working a fast-paced environment
●    Experience working with people who have high standards, even higher expectations and can be demanding!
 
**Salary**
Salary will be £20,000 to £22,000 depending on experience
Salary will be paid in twelve equal monthly instalments
 
**Perks**
·    You will receive £500 p.a. as a training budget to grow your skills
·    Opportunity to work events with paid overtime at a rate of £25/ph
·    Regular community and Team socials including pizza nights, Christmas away days, games nights, summer parties etc. 
·    Student Discounts through UCL
·    Opportunities for career development and growth within the role.  

**Hours of Work**
Full-time hours over an average of 40 hours per week (including a 1 hour unpaid lunch break)

**Annual Leave**
You will be entitled to 25 working days annual leave plus bank holidays per annum, as well as additional time off between Christmas and New Year.

**To Apply**
Please submit a cover letter and CV by the 28th of February 2020

jobs.title: OneTech Project Officer
jobs.description:
Job Role: OneTech Project Officer

Location: WeWork, 70 Wilson Street or IDEALondon, 69 Wilson Street - tbc

Role: Capital Enterprise is looking to recruit a Project Officer to support OneTech. You will be tasked to assist with the day-to-day running of the project and work closely with the MD and Project Team to make sure the project runs smoothly.
Duration:  In the first instance, this role will last for 1 year (subject to contract) with the possibility of extending. 

OneTech Summary
OneTech connects under represented communities with  opportunities in London’s tech startup ecosystem. We want to change the face of London’s startups. We have attracted a number of different grants and are working with a wide range of delivery partners including UKBlackTech, Diversity VC, FounderVine and YSYS. 
The original OneTech project kicked off in 2018 and we have plans to move it from being a project to becoming a sustainable movement of change. As such it has recently moved to being a semi autonomous structure within Capital Enterprise with its own MD, team and Advisory Group. 
You will be accountable to the OneTech Programme Manager and MD and will work as part of a small and friendly team, building a network of contacts and colleagues across a range of partner organisations and institutions. This is a fantastic opportunity to get involved in a high-profile activity supporting our ambitious plans to increase diversity in London’s start-up ecosystem. 
OneTech launched in 2018 and, at least for now, will continue until June 2023. Capital Enterprise is looking to appoint a Project Officer to support the project team to deliver and run the programme in line with its time, budget and quality requirements.

Capital Enterprise
We are London’s start-up experts, connecting and energising a world-class entrepreneurship ecosystem. We are a body of connectors, influencers, investors and policy-makers, collaborating to super-charge London’s start-up scene. We exist to support entrepreneurs and businesses in London. We are mission-driven and a not-for profit organisation owned by, and run for the benefit of, members.
Capital Enterprise and its members provide a wide range of support services including advice, training, mentoring, accelerator programmes, specialist technical expertise, networking, soft loan finance and incubator accommodation to both pre start and trading entrepreneurs and small businesses in all 33 London Boroughs.
Capital Enterprise is funded through members subscriptions, third party sponsorship and by income received from public/private sector partners to develop, pilot and manage innovative programmes that support enterprises and entrepreneurs in London.

 Roles and Responsibilities
●	Day-to-day administration of the project together with the project team
●	Filing project records
●	On boarding calls with entrepreneurs
●	Assist with reports on outputs for the project
●	Support database management, e.g. input new and update existing data on the customer relationship management database
●	Assist the project team with all communication through clear verbal and written correspondence with delivery partners, service providers, staff, founders and startups.
●	Create and maintain a database of venues for external events
●	Arrange meetings, meeting rooms & catering as required for both internal meetings and external events
●	Logging participation at events for monitoring purposes
●	Undertake administrative tasks involved in all aspects of events organisation, including booking speakers and liaising to ensure their requirements are met, the booking of rooms, ordering of catering, production of delegate packs and name badges etc.
●	Assist the Team in creating the six monthly progress and activity reports
●	Assist with event related travel and accommodation arrangements
●	Support the registration process for events using our online Events Management system (eventbrite) and provide basic reports
●	Attend regular events organised by the team to assist with event delivery. This will include events outside normal working hours
●	Support inbox and diary management for senior staff
●	Data entry and ensuring the existing data in the database is accurate
●	To undertake other tasks as appropriate as directed by the project team

 Experience
●	Applicants must have a minimum of Undergraduate Degree or equivalent
●	A high level of oral and written communication in english and numeracy is required
●	Ability work on own initiative, with minimal supervision and able to prioritise own workload
●	Excellent ICT skills including experience of using all Google and Microsoft Office-suite programmes and other applications such as Eventbrite, calendly, Mailchimp, Wordpress, xxx xxx
●	Tact and discretion in the handling of highly confidential and sensitive information
●	A high level of accuracy and consistent attention to detail
●	Ability to successfully manage a variety of tasks to deadline and to work calmly under pressure
●	Ability to communicate well with people and develop effective working relationships
●	Flexibility – we are a small organisation and operate as a team. While the role and key responsibilities are described above, new areas of work may emerge
●	Willingness to act as a face of the organisation with both individual members and external stakeholders
●	Ability to excel in a modern, fast-paced and informal organisational setting 
●	Strong organisational capabilities, with the ability to establish systems and manage information
●	Excellent interpersonal skills, with an ability to establish and build working relationships with a range of individuals from different backgrounds and organisations
●	Experience in customer service roles
●	A team player with the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationship with a wide range of stakeholders and partners

 Desirable
●	 Experience of event coordination and/or marketing and communications
●	 Experience of project administration and support
●	Commitment to diversity

Salary
Salary will be £23,000 - £25,000 depending on experience. Salary will be paid in 12 monthly installments. There may be opportunities for progression for the right candidate. 

Probation
Appointments are subject to receipt of satisfactory references and a probationary period of 9 months.

Hours of Work
Full time hours average 40 hours per week

Holiday
You will be entitled to 25 working days annual leave plus bank holidays per annum, as well as additional time off between Christmas and New Year.

How to Apply
To apply for the vacancy send a CV and a cover letter to Martha@capitalenterprise.org

The closing date for applications is Friday 6 March 2020 and interviews will be held in the follwing weeks.
